intro: Cecropia telenitida, commonly known as the African ceiba, is a fast-growing tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Moraceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and distinctive, hollow stems. The plant is often found in disturbed habitats such as forest edges and clearings due to its ability to thrive in various soil types. Its fruit is a spiky, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. Cecropia telenitida plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
